title: Former President Truman Stands in Front of his House in Independence
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman talks to unidentified men outside of his home on N. Delaware St. in Independence, MO. "H.S.T." is written on the photograph. Sent to the Truman Library by Monroe May, found in Post-Presidential Papers, General Correspondence, May-Maydz.
Related Collection: Harry S. Truman Papers Post-Presidential Papers

title: Harry S. Truman Attends Masonic Ceremony
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (standing center, wearing apron) takes part in an unidentified Masonic ceremony with two unidentified men.

title: Portrait of Harry S. Truman Signing a Book
Scopenote: Portrait with dramatic lighting of former President Harry S. Truman sitting at a desk and writing in a book. Photo is a gift of the estate of Dr. Milton Reisch.

title: Former President Truman with Unidentified Man on Tarmac
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman is pictured with an unidentified man next to an airplane. From Post-Presidential Papers, General Correspondence, Mam-Manhz.
Related Collection: Harry S. Truman Papers Post-Presidential Papers

title: Former President Truman with Unknown Man and Police Officers
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) with unknown man and police officers. Found in Post-Presidential Papers, General Correspondence, Pom-Pors.
Related Collection: Harry S. Truman Papers Post-Presidential Papers

title: Former President Truman with Fellow Masons
Scopenote: Seated in the Truman Library are Masons (l to r): Former Grand Master Frank P. Briggs, Former President of the United States and Grand Master of Missouri Harry S. Truman, and Robert Mann. They are seated below Greta Kempton's portrait of Truman in his Masonic regalia.

title: Harry S. Truman Reference Portrait
Scopenote: Profile portrait of President Harry S. Truman wearing a bowtie. This photo was used as a reference picture for portrait artist Greta Kempton to create her paintings of Truman. The photo is torn and there is tape on the top and right sides where the photograph was moved around to be used as reference.

title: President Truman on Rear Platform of Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands on the rear platform of a train after dark. From Post-Presidential Papers, General Correspondence, Per- Perkins.
Related Collection: Harry S. Truman Papers Post-Presidential Papers

title: Truman, Snyder, and Vaughan at Army Reserve Camp in Fort Riley, Kansas
Scopenote: (L to R) Harry S. Truman, John W. Snyder, and Harry Vaughan in uniform at Army Reserve Camp at Fort Riley, Kansas.

title: Senator Truman at Detroit Masonic Lodge
Scopenote: Standing left to right, with their signatures below their images: Oliver "Ollie" Blanchard; Detroit City Clerk Thomas "Tom" Leadbetter; Senator Homer Ferguson; Senator Harry S. Truman; Bill [illegible]; and Bob Moore. Left of signatures reads "Zion Lodge #1. F&AM Detroit Mich. April 12, 1944. Senator Truman gave a speech in honor of the 180th anniversary of the Masonic Zion Lodge #1 in Michigan.

title: Destroyed Nagarekawa Methodist Church of Christ in Hiroshima
Scopenote: Side view of the destroyed Nagarekawa Methodist Church of Christ in Hiroshima, Japan, after the atomic bomb destroyed the city. Behind the church is the Hiroshima Central Broadcasting Office and Shukkeien Park. Cracks in the lantern slide are visible across the top of the image.

title: Man Sitting Among the Destruction in Hiroshima
Scopenote: An unidentified man wearing a hat sits wearing hat in the middle of the atomic bomb destruction in Hiroshima, Japan, with the remnants of Nagarekawa Methodist Church of Christ standing in the background.

title: Destroyed Building in Japan
Scopenote: Atomic bomb destruction showing an unidentified masonry building with the second floor hanging down over first floor, probably located in Nagasaki, Japan.

title: President Truman at United Nations Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind the lectern) addresses the closing session of the United Nations Conference on International Organization in San Francisco, California. Seated on the right is Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (closest to lectern) and Secretary-General of the Conference Alger Hiss. Seated behind President Truman is Military Aide Major General Harry Vaughan (left) and Naval Aide Captain James Vardaman (right). All others are unidentified. Donor: Margaret Poore.

title: President Truman and General Eisenhower Talk in Frankfort, Germany
Scopenote: In the foreground facing the camera are Lieutenant Kay Summersby, General Dwight D. Eisenhower, and President Harry S. Truman. In the background, to the right of Truman is General Harry Vaughan. All other military personnel at the airfield are unidentified. The President is in Frankfort, Germany traveling during a break in the Potsdam Conference. Donated in the name of Don Costello.

title: Hiroshima Prefectural Industrial Promotion Hall Destroyed by the Atomic Bomb
Scopenote: View of a partially destroyed building with dome, the Hiroshima Prefectural Industrial Promotion Hall (now the Atomic Bomb Dome), as seen from the partially destroyed Motoyasu Bridge, looking north. The Motoyasu River is in the foreground. The building was destroyed by the atomic bomb and allowed to stand as a reminder and memorial.

title: Destroyed Urakami Cathedral Tower in Nagasaki
Scopenote: Remains of Urakami Cathedral in Nagasaki, Japan, after the atomic bomb destroyed the city. The entrance tower is partially intact with arch and round window openings above. A sign in Japanese stands in front of the ruins. A portion of the temporary church building is on the right.

title: President Truman Visits Mexican President Aleman in Mexico City
Scopenote: President Harry S Truman (front right) greets Mexican President Aleman (front left) while on a state visit to Mexico City. A crowd of people looks on, including a group of musicians with a large marimba. From Post-Presidential Papers, General Correspondence, Mexico.
Related Collection: Harry S. Truman Papers Post-Presidential Papers

title: President Truman Poses for Greta Kempton
Scopenote: Close-up photo of President Harry S. Truman wearing Masonic chain collar, posed for Greta Kempton's Masonic portrait. See also 67-938.

title: President Truman Visiting Puget Sound Naval Shipyard in Bremerton, Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (light suit) visits naval officers at the Puget Sound Naval Shipyard in Bremerton, Washington. Slightly behind and to the left of Truman is Captain Robert Dennison. All other officers are unidentified. Donated by Julia White

title: View of Hiroshima Showing Early Construction of ABCC on Hijiyama Hill
Scopenote: Aerial view of Hiroshima, Japan, showing early construction of the Atomic Bomb Casualty Commission site on Hijiyama Hill in the center foreground, looking west across the Kayobashi River.

title: President Truman Attends Allegheny County Fair
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) sits below a large American Flag during an outdoor stadium appearance at the Allegheny County Fair, South Park, Pennsylvania. Others in picture are unidentified.

title: President Truman Arrives for Allegheny County Fair
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiles and waves his hat as he steps from an airplane for the Allegheny County Fair, South Park, PA.

title: President Truman Meets with the Home Owners' Loan Corporation Officials
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) receives check from the Home Owners' Loan Corporation (HOLC) representing the remaining funds of the HOLC after all obligations have been paid and doors have been closed. Standing (L to R): J. Stanley Baughman, Manager HOLC; J. Alston Adams, Republican Member Federal Home Loan Bank Board (FHLBB); Raymond Foley, Administrator, Housing and Home Finance Agency; John Snyder, Secretary of the Treasury; Oscar Kent LaRoque, Democratic Member FHLBB; William Divers, Chairman of the FHLBB; John Fahey, Chairman of the HOLC.

title: Two Laboratory Scientists Conduct Tests for the Atomic Bomb Casualty Commission
Scopenote: Two scientists use test tubes to conduct tests at the Atomic Bomb Casualty Commission lab in Hiroshima.

title: President Truman Meets with General Eisenhower in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman gestures while speaking to General Dwight D. Eisenhower in the Oval Office at the White House, in an off-the-record meeting on military affairs and the speed-up of Western European re-armament. (see also 2002-202).

title: President Truman Receives Lincoln Bust from Cartoonists
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far left) receives bust of Abraham Lincoln from cartoonists (L to R) Milton Caniff, Russell Patterson, and Harry Hershfield during a White House Rose Garden ceremony. The bust was made by sculptor Leonard Volk and presented in the name of the National Cartoonist Society, and is the Truman Library's artifact collection (item 741). See also photo 63-1421-01. Photo donated by Brian Merlis.

title: President Truman Makes a Whistlestop Visit to Fargo, North Dakota
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the rear platform speaking to a crowd at Fargo, North Dakota. A banner from radio station WDAY hangs from the lectern in front of him.

title: President Truman and Margaret Truman Appear on Train in Fargo, North Dakota
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman appear on the rear platform of a train at a whistlestop appearance in Fargo, North Dakota.

title: Meeting of Reserve Officers Association at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Past Presidents of the Kansas City Chapter #1, Reserve Officers Association Meeting gathered in former president Harry S. Truman's office at the Truman Library shown left to right are: James G. Harper, John Gaylord, James Moore, Edward G. Otto, Dinwiddie Groves, John Lee, Milton Leith, Sidney Newburger, Russell Knight, Jo Zach Miller III, former president Truman, Joe Crawford, Kenneth Fox, Rufus Burrus, Fred Whitten, Meyer Goldman, Bob Kernodle, and Ted Bland. Image sent to Truman Presidential Library by Graham Campbell II.

title: Former President Truman at Rockhurst College
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands at a lectern wearing academic regalia after receiving an honorary law degree, the LL.D., from Rockhurst College in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Former President Truman with a Young Library Visitor
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman poses at the Truman Library with a young boy in a cowboy costume. Written on the picture is "To my friend Mr. Truman, David M." Found in Post-Presidential Papers, General Correspondence, Mill-Milz.
Related Collection: Harry S. Truman Papers Post-Presidential Papers
